document_data.name: Ysval
document_data.mainbody: '''Ysval''' was a [[nighthaunt]] from the [[Plane of Shadow]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]..
document_data.Description: As a nighthaunt, Ysval somewhat resembled a [[gargoyle]] with bat wings, talons, curling horns, and a whipping serpentine tail. His body looked as if made of the [[Shadowstuff|shadow-stuff]] of the night itself. He had no face, just a flat triangular space set with a pair of pale eyes, blank and round as [[pearl]]s.
document_data.Abilities: Unlike many other [[undead]] creatures, Ysval could bear the touch of sunlight without actual harm, though it made him feel uncomfortable. He had the mystical strength to darken the day to a point where it seemed almost as dark as during the night. When conversing with his underlings, Ysval used a psychic bond for communication without words.
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1375}}, Ysval led an army of undead to conquer [[Thay]] He felt kinship with [[Shex]], one of his commanders.

He was slain by the combined attacks of [[Bareris Anskuld]], [[Mirror (ghost)|Mirror]], [[Aoth Fezim]], [[Milsantos Daramos]], and [[Nymia Focar]] at the fight of [[Keep of Thazar|Thazar Keep]].
